Description: Lower body sherd (mended from four fragments) of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip, glaze fired orange; interior glazed streaky black with three pairs of added white bands; exterior: trace of undetermined decoration (below handle join on 1924,1201.854) above five wide brown bands; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The sherd joins British Museum 1924,1201.854. The limited interior decoration may suggest that the chalice was an early piece in the series.
Bibliographic references: Gardner 1888 / Naukratis II (p. 63, no. 708, pl. XXI, no. 708)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 252, no. 1)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 677, no. 359, pl. 29.3)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0413) (phase 2)
